definition: to withdraw/to remove (from a place)/to remove from office
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: We apologise and are in the process of pulling down the image.
sentences.chinese: 我们深表歉意，并且正在将图片撤下。

sentences.english: Prominent anti-American slogans in Tienanmen Square have still not been taken down.
sentences.chinese: 天安门广场上显眼的反美标语仍没有被撤下。

sentences.english: Note that food is served from the left and empty plates are cleared from the right.
sentences.chinese: 注意每道菜都是从左边端上来，空盘子从右边撤下去。

sentences.english: They were later taken off the case and transferred to other duties.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来从这个案子中被撤下，调到其它岗位上去了。

sentences.english: Take her name off the masthead for three months.
sentences.chinese: 把她的名字从刊头上撤下去三个月。

sentences.english: Saying so, he unveils the sheet of calico from the corpse.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说着一边撤下了那块盖在尸体上的白布。

sentences.english: This would help her organization sunset one of the products in the favor of other.
sentences.chinese: 这帮她所在的组织撤下一款产品，选择了另一款。

sentences.english: In the Phantom's house, Christine pulled off his mask.
sentences.chinese: 在幽灵的房子里，克里斯汀撤下了他的面具。

sentences.english: Run, Beth, and help Hannah clear half the things off the table.
sentences.chinese: 贝思，快跑去帮罕娜撤下桌上的一半食物。

sentences.english: The FBI said the photo of bin Laden would be removed from the Web site.
sentences.chinese: 美国联邦调查局称将把这张照片从该网站上撤下。

sentences.english: The sole was removed by roast beef.
sentences.chinese: 鲽鱼撤下去，下一道菜上的是烤牛肉。

sentences.english: Google have since removed the image.
sentences.chinese: 现在谷歌已经撤下了这张照片。

sentences.english: The article receded from the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章从报纸上撤下了。

definition: to cut/to throw out/to depose (from office)/to tear off
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation)/to resort to (some tactic)
to beat the gong to recall troops (idiom); to order a retreat
to be on call/to be on standby
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
